page.title: 04A DAY ON A DAIRY FARM
page.content: Our farm,Netherton, is about 160 acres of grassland,with about a quarter of an acre for growing vegetables for ourselves. My day begins at 6.00a.m. when my husband and I rise to prepare for the morning milking.We milk 48 dairy cows (Ayrshire and Friesians) twice a day. During milking I feed the youngest calves,up to 3 months old,with warm milk,cake and a little hay. After breakfast, the byre has to be cleaned and washed,and the milking machines,pipeline and milk tank have to be sterilised. The rest of the morning is spent in tractors,cutting or spreading hay. About 4.00p.m.the cows are milked and the calves are fed again.In the evening we bring in the hay and stack the bales.Many helpers are needed.
